attributes.action: Open up empty property to the homeless and refugees.
attributes.additional_details:
Households applying to their local authority for homelessness assistance 3014/15:
England: 112,330 - a 26 per cent rise since 2009/10
Wales: 14,160 
Scotland: 35,000
[source:http://www.crisis.org.uk/pages/homeless-def-numbers.html]
Vacant homes in England:
 610,000 empty homes  with over 200,000 long-term vacant dwellings (that is homes unoccupied for over six months). [source:https://www.gov.uk/government/statistical-data-sets/live-tables-on-dwelling-stock-including-vacants
attributes.background:
In many cities in the UK property stands empty, producing no council tax and blighting communities.

This situation is morally and ethically indefensible when British citizens remain homeless and refugees need shelter.

It's time that empty property is made to work for the good of society.
